SENT.plain: Acute hepatotoxicity is a rare but potentially fatal complication of amiodarone use

Although oral long-term use of the drug is frequently complicated by an asymptomatic rise in serum aminotransferase concentrations, acute hepatotoxicity during intravenous loading is much less frequent and potentially fatal
We report a case of liver injury after intravenous administration in a patient with atrial fibrillation
